entries.content:
The dot field that greets you on the homepage started as a humble wave grid. Inside index.html it now behaves like an instrument: every control in the lil-gui panel changes the physics in real time, while the retro menu nudges the shader with context-aware presets.

The field learns nine behaviours. Zen flattens the grid until it becomes a calm oscilloscope. Jitter fires micro ripples that make the particles strobe. Swirl and Spiral twist the grid into vortices. Quake sends seismic waves from your pointer, Hop dives through Mandelbrot spirals, Bloom grows reaction-diffusion petals, Blink traces pendulum harmonics, and Stars lifts the dots into a drifting nebula.

The fun part is how these modes layer: the pointer energy and ripple queue keep listening even while presets run, so the composition never repeats. This study captures screenshots, parameter sets, and motion notes pulled directly from that source file so future installations can remix the same field.
